response.original_title: The Long Walk: Tears of the Navajo
response.overview: The Long Walk: Tears of the Navajo is a documentary that tells the history of when the United States Army marched over eight thousand Navajo men, women, and children at gunpoint through three hundred miles of desert in the Southwest to a prison camp in eastern New Mexico. Hundreds of people died from starvation and exposure to the winter elements.
response.title: The Long Walk: Tears of the Navajo
